reviews.text: We found this hotel by accident, but it was really good luck. For very low price they offer amazing housekeeping service, also all staff is very friendly and always willing to help 24 hours a day. It's close to the main SF atractions and we really enjoyed our stay in here and can only recommend...
reviews.title: Nice and peaceful stay

reviews.text: My wife and I enjoyed two great days at the Redwood Inn this last August, 2007. We arrived without reservations and were welcomed warmly by the management. The room we were given was spacious and clean and had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable. This is not a sparkley new inn, but it is well cared for and very clean. We especially enjoyed Mr. Yan Cheung who gave us a wealth of information about visiting his city, recommended a Chinese Restaurant in Chinatown, and generally was entertaining as well as informative. We found it to be close enough to walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardilli Square (twice!). The famous "crooked" part of Lombard St. is within a mile of this location. In large part thanks to Mr. Cheug, we will make every effort to stay at this inn on our next visit.
reviews.title: Excellent experience at the Redwood Inn
be sure to book ahead!
reviews.text: For our first visit to San Francisco we were very fortunate to have done our homework and stayed at the Redwood Inn. The inn is spotless and staffed by the warmest and most helpful and courteous staff. Located on historic Lombard Street near the famous "zig-zag" it is ideal for getting out and around to all that San Francisco has to offer. If you are looking for a safe, clean and comfortable place to stay while visiting SF that provides secure parking for your car ...and is reasonably priced ...I would recommend the Redwood Inn without the slightest hesitation! Thanks to Yan and May for a great stay!

reviews.title: A great choice
reviews.text: I have been staying in the Redwood Inn hotel in Lombard street for 2 nights with a friend of mine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was a great choice. The room rate, under the avarage of its competitors, worth completly the more-than-good room, the free car parking, the wireless connection and some tasty donuts for breakfast. All the staff was really friendly and I had not any sort of problems.
reviews.title: Last Minute Booking in Dirty Hotel

reviews.text: This was a great hotel for our 4 night stay in SF. Just to say that when we arrived in SF, a huge convention was in town and it was our final hope after 6 different hotels before heading out of town. Every single hotel we tried had over inflated prices - the Holiday Inn wanted 379 a night! Even the price of the less attractive hotel across the road was $240 for a double
reviews.title: Friendliness is not Extinct

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: May, the owner, was wonderful and she was surprised at my surprise that the rate was still extremely reasonable despite the high prices of the other hotels. The rooms where extremely clean, the location with half hour walk of everything and of course, the free parking made it much easier than our other stays in the States.
reviews.title: Great find!!

reviews.text: On top of all of this, the bubble-brain that i am left my wallet and they happily sent it back to Australia, arriving a week after we left
reviews.title: Great time
great stay
reviews.text: Would definetly recommend it, if only on the fact that they didn't attempt to rip us off like everyone else tried

After going hotel to hotel looking for a room, we found this one!!! Hotel room was very clean, had cable tv, refrigerator, and coffee maker. Price was very reasonable for the area - and included parking!!! Lobby person who greeted us was very helpful and friendly. She took time in giving us a map and pointing out the attractions we shouldn't miss in the area. They had donuts and coffee in the lobby in the mornings.
reviews.title: Good hotel, good location

reviews.text: what can i say .. I love this city now and would certainly suggest this hotel to friends and family
reviews.title: STAY AWAY!!!!!

likes.liked: — dirty hotel, with no hot water!!!! and a $50 deposit for a TV changer

reviews.text: We stayed here for four days and we enjoyed our stay in Redwood Inn. The room is comfortable and the service is excellence. The staffs have helped us a lot. The location is convenience. We recommend this motel to our friends who visit San Francisco.
reviews.title: Good hotel to stay

reviews.text: We are four tourists from Sweden and stayed in Redwood Inn starting on July 25 for five nights. We are happy and enjoyed our stay here. The staff are helpful and service are very good. The room was clean and tidy. The location is convenient and has good bus connection to the city and attraction sites. We definetely recommend Redwood Inn to my friends.
reviews.title: Good Place to stay

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for my family of five, kids 11, 11, and 8. Room had 2 double beds and a rollaway.
reviews.title: Specific Pros and Cons

reviews.text: Pros = Value, we got this room at $150/night with free parking and doughnuts/muffins in the office. Microwave, frig, large room on the corner (room 49) of the top floor. For 5 people, in this city, this was pretty cheap, given what I was finding. The front desk woman was helpful. There was an elevator, albeit very slow, that really helped with all our bags. Bathroom was small, but adequate - overall the room was spacious.
reviews.title: great hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Neutral = Location was safe, and not too far from Ghirardelli Square - maybe 7-8 blocks? But with kids, it's not totally ideal - next time I would probably stay at Union Square, where there is a cable car turnabout right there. You cant catch the cars near the hotel, according to the desk. But that said, it was a reasonable walk to Ghirardelli and not that bad to the Wharf. The cleanliness of the room was fine - it wasn't blowing me away, but it wasn't dingy either. It is definitely a budget hotel, and if I weren't in the heart of SF, I would not have considered this as big a bargain.
reviews.title: Great place, nice service, very cheap!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Redwood Inn in San Francisco from May 10th
reviews.title: Loved the Redwood Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to the 13th really enjoyed my stay.The room was clean and
reviews.title: Good price, great location, great staff

reviews.text: roomy had a coffee-maker and a small refrig for drinks or
anything that you want. The room was cleaned every day and
reviews.title: A very welcoming stay.

likes.liked: — Great location, friendly staff, good quality rooms
likes.disliked: — I had nothing to complain about, it was all good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the motel staff was very helpful with directions and places to
reviews.title: Very friendly staff
stay here if you go to san francisco!
reviews.text: I have never had them give you a TV remote with the key and take a $50 deposite- she kept asking for cash (in an AAA 3-star), but hey, that's fine. The bathroom was the cleanest part of the hotel (just remodeled). The carpet and furniture had very visible stains and appeared to be well over a decade in age. Check out was 11 am on Sunday and when I asked for a noon check out I was told I would be charged another nights rate if we were not checked out by 11:30 am.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was not a comfortable stay, although the location was terrific.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

likes.disliked: — internet was not easy to use

reviews.text: we had such a good time here during our stay in this wonderful city and motel! it's in a perfect location and the rooms have all the facilities. also there is good breakfast in the morning and internet is free and works in its way! Everyday they clean your room and make your stay comfortable. There is a free parking if you are driving a car.
reviews.title: excellent service and very comfortable
Great Time in San Francisco & Redwood Inn
reviews.text: Go to redwood inn!

First of all, I stayed for 7 nights, so they gave me a $65/night rate. I was thinking it might be tiny and dirty because of the price, but it was one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed at, regardless of how many star ratings the others have. The room was quite large, with a table and chairs, microwave, and fridge in the room. The bed was a little hard, but I didn't mind too much. I never had the doughnuts in the morning, but they were in the lobby every morning. This hotel is a 10 minute walk to just about anything in the Fisherman's Wharf, and has several main bus routes within 2-3 minutes walking time. If I ever make it back to San Francisco, I will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great value and close to everything

reviews.text: Great hotel for the price. Clean, comfortable and safe location. Off street parking was a bonus. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: great value

likes.disliked: — street noise. Nothing ear plugs didn't fix.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 2 nights in late January 2008. No compaints
reviews.title: Good Value, free parking
